curam.util.ctm.bom

Class MapDataComparer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.ctm.bom.MapDataComparer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BusinessObjectsComparer

    public abstract class MapDataComparer
extends java.lang.Object
    A comparer implementation that can compare two sets of data originating from a map and will report the differences among the data set.

    The algorithm written for comparison uses the standard Template design pattern thereby allowing customizations for the sub-classes on the following execution points

    • The type of data that can be included or excluded from comparison
    • The equality nature of two objects of the same type
    • Hook for performing initialization stuffs before comparison
    • Determining the key columns for a given class type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapDataComparer(MultiValuedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> leftSideDataMap, MultiValuedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> rightSideDataMap)
      Constructs a new comparer object from two map data sets that logically acts as left-sided data and right-sided data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      void compare()
      Starts the comparison process which iterates over the map of data and suitably calls the available hook methods for comparison finally constructing the comparison result.
      protected abstract boolean compareEntities(java.lang.String aKeyType, java.lang.Object leftSideData, java.lang.Object rightSideData)
      Method that compare objects and that will provide an indication to the framework denoting whether the data is newly added or not.
      ComparisonResult getComparisonResult()
      Returns the comparison result which will included the list of objects added, deleted after comparison.
      protected boolean isTypeEligibleForComparison(java.lang.String aKeyType)
      Customizable method that a sub class can override to indicate whether data with respect to the incoming key is eligible for comparison.
      protected void performComparison()
      Performs the comparison between the left sided and the right sided data by iterating over the map data set.
      protected void startComparison()
      Customizable method which a sub-class can use to initialize specific data items before the comparison process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapDataComparer

        public MapDataComparer(MultiValuedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> leftSideDataMap,
                       MultiValuedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> rightSideDataMap)
        Constructs a new comparer object from two map data sets that logically acts as left-sided data and right-sided data.
        Parameters:
        leftSideDataMap - The map of data that is logically placed in the left-side during comparison.
        rightSideDataMap - The map of data that is logically placed in the right side during comparison.

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public final void compare()
        Starts the comparison process which iterates over the map of data and suitably calls the available hook methods for comparison finally constructing the comparison result.

      • startComparison

        protected void startComparison()
        Customizable method which a sub-class can use to initialize specific data items before the comparison process.

      • performComparison

        protected void performComparison()
        Performs the comparison between the left sided and the right sided data by iterating over the map data set. Once the comparison operation is completed, the results of the comparison will be constructed and stored for later usage.

      • isTypeEligibleForComparison

        protected boolean isTypeEligibleForComparison(java.lang.String aKeyType)
        Customizable method that a sub class can override to indicate whether data with respect to the incoming key is eligible for comparison.
        Parameters:
        aKeyType - The incoming key type for which has eligibility factor has to be decided for comparison.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE if the key is eligible for comparison, else FALSE

      • compareEntities

        protected abstract boolean compareEntities(java.lang.String aKeyType,
                                           java.lang.Object leftSideData,
                                           java.lang.Object rightSideData)
        Method that compare objects and that will provide an indication to the framework denoting whether the data is newly added or not.
        Parameters:
        aKeyType - The key for the set of the objects to be compared.
        leftSideData - The left side data for the incoming key.
        rightSideData - The right side data for the incoming key.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE if the objects are equal in nature, else FALSE.

      • getComparisonResult

        public ComparisonResult getComparisonResult()
        Returns the comparison result which will included the list of objects added, deleted after comparison.
        Returns:
        The comparison result containing the report after comparison.
